文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk1
证据片段: In 1969, analysis of fuel defects in the Douglas Point power reactor indicated that the power ramp defects tended to occur preferentially in fuel with high strength/low ductility sheathing.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk1
证据片段: We conclude that the initial metallurgical properties of the tubing have little influence on the defect behavior of power ramped fuel; thus the limits on mechanical property requirements of the sheath have become less stringent.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk2
证据片段: after an irradiation of 2 to $3 ~ \times$ $1 \bar { 0 } ^ { 2 4 }$ neutrons $( { \bf n } ) / { \bf m } ^ { 2 } ( > 1 \ { \bf M } { \bf e } { \bf V } )$ at $\backsim 3 0 0 \%$ , the ductility of Zircaloy tubes with a high level of cold work was very low

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk2
证据片段: tubes with a room temperature axial ultimate tensile strength (UTS) of $> 7 0 0$ MPa $( > 1 0 0 \ \mathrm { k s i } )$ had a total circumferential elongation (TCE) of less than 1 percent in a $3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ burst test after irradiation

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk2
证据片段: The sheathing specification therefore was changed to ensure a high TCE in the burst test $_ { ( > 1 8 . 5 }$ percent) before irradiation

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk2
证据片段: Annealed Zircaloy has a lower in-reactor creep rate than cold worked material

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk3
STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk4
证据片段: U-226 and U-228 Bundle BA Outer Element Linear Power Low Power Prior to Ramp 22.9 kW/m

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: CANDU fuel bundles incorporate $\mathbf { Z r - S B e }$ brazements for attaching Zircaloy interelement spacer pads and bundle-to-pressure tube bearing pads to the Zircaloy sheaths

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: The brazing cycle involves heating the circumference of the sheath to $1 0 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ in about $4 5 \ \mathsf { s }$ , holding at temperature for $2 0 \ \mathsf { s }$ , and cooling at about $1 5 \%$

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: The braze HAZs generally have lower strength (axial yield strength $\sim \sim \sim \sim 0$ MPa) and lower ductility $( \mathrm { T C E } = 1 4 . 5 $ to 18.4 percent) than the as-received (tube-reduced and stress-relieved) material

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: the fuel defect rate since 1972 has been about 0.03 percent

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: the basketweave structure has been favored because it has a higher total circumferential elongation in the burst test than the parallel plate structure

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: Early iodine stress corrosion tests on specimens cut from irradiated Pickering-size fuel elements showed that the braze HAZs were more susceptible to cracking than the as-received (tube-reduced and stress-relieved) specimens

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk5
证据片段: recent results with Bruce-size sheathing have given the opposite result

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk6
证据片段: Stringent specification of sheath mechanical properties to avoid power ramp defects is not warranted

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk6
证据片段: Sheath mechanical properties can be based on other considerations such as the necessity to resist collapse or longitudinal ridging due to the coolant pressure

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk6
证据片段: The presence of braze HAZs in the sheathing, which considerably alters the structure and mechanical properties, does not affect significantly the performance of CANDU fuel bundles

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_012_chunk6
证据片段: Proper fuel management to limit maximum bundle powers and power increases and the use of CANLUB sheath coatings have proved to be the best ways of reducing the number of fuel defects due to power increases
